page.title: 01BICESTER A MARKET TOWN.
page.content: Bicester is an historic market town, there has been a market held here since 1239.Sheep and cattle were sold in Sheep Street but nowadays a cattle market is held in Victoria Road.On a Friday a market is held in the square, which is popular having a good variety of stalls. The town has always been a recognised market centre for the rich agricultural district.Several farms can still be found on the perimeter.These are mixed farms having both cattle and cereals. The town has been redeveloped over the past few years and more facilities have been provided.At present there is new development to the north and west of the town centre. New industrial units and large housing estates have been put up in the past 5 years.
